lines.line: Nilsal, traveller. I was injured while exploring down here. Could you spare me some cooked fish, meat or vegetables?
It just so happens that I have some with me!
Oh, please hand it over if you can spare it.
I'm afraid that I don't have any of that type of food with me.
Oh, well if you return with any I would greatly appreciate it.
No thanks. I would rather eat fish, meat or vegetables.
Thanks for helping me. Is there anything you'd like to know about this temple? If you find anything in here, show it to me and I'll tell you what I know about it.
What is this place?
This place probably had a name at some point but it has long since been forgotten. The Arceuus librarians refer to this place as the Forthos Dungeon.
It is rumoured that this place used to be of religious significance to druidic followers of both Ralos and Ranul.
Who are Ralos and Ranul?
According to religious texts, Ralos is the god of the sun and Ranul, his brother, is the god of the moon.
If you find any artifacts or relics from within this temple, I would be very interested in seeing them.
I'll see what I find. Although, I've never heard of Ralos and Ranul.
You need only to look up and see their greatness above you when you return to the surface.
Who are you?
My name is Brother Aimeri, I am a travelling monk from the distant land of Varlamore on a journey to uncover the secrets of this temple.
I worship Ralos, a common practice where I am from. However, I found out that our order may have originated from this temple. If you find anything of interest, please let me know.
I'll keep my eyes open.
You have my gratitude. Any information you do find would also be of interest to the Arceuus Library. I hope we can uncover the secrets of this place for the greater good.
The greater good.
How did you get injured?
I found out about this place from Logosia in the Arceuus Library. I came to investigate but was ambushed by the spiders in the room to the north.
I'm a scholar not a fighter. I didn't have time to think through my options so I did what came naturally and ran away.
Why didn't you decide to run back the way you came from instead of running further into the dungeon where there could be more dangerous creatures?
See, the problem with that... Is that it is an excellent idea I wish I had thought of at the time.
You've been trapped here for a while! No wonder you were hungry!
I'm fine, thanks.
Oh, very interesting. This page appears to be taken from a religious script which speaks of Ralos.
This is very sad. To see such religious scripts desecrated, it's blasphemy!
Perhaps the script still exists?
Yes, yes! I hope so. I would expect a temple of this nature to have a library of sorts within it. Maybe the original is somewhere within it.
I'll have a look for it. Thanks for your help!
Oh, very interesting. This page appears to be taken from a religious script which speaks of Ranul.
Oh, very interesting. This page appears to be taken from a historical script about the temple itself.
This is very sad. To see such information desecrated in this way.
Amazing! This is exactly what I was looking for. This tome contains information about the religion of Ralos.
Oh, it appears that there are some pages missing from it. The missing information could prove valuable.
Where do you think the missing pages are?
This Temple has been abandoned for some time. Maybe the creatures within have destroyed the tome while looking for food. You may have to kill them to recover the pages.
Thanks for your help!
The book seems to be intact! I'm sure Logosia in the Arceuus Library to the north would find this information valuable.
Amazing! This is exactly what I was looking for. This tome contains information about the religion of Ranul.
Amazing! This is exactly what I was looking for. This tome contains information about the temple itself.
I have not seen this before. Your donation to the library is appreciated.
You can have this tome which I discovered aswell.
You can have these tomes which I discovered aswell.
Your contributions to the library have been noticed. We would like to reward you for your assistance.
If you find any spare pages for these books I would be willing to give you 1,000 gold for each one. Duplicate sources of information are always useful.
I'll keep an eye out.
Enough talk now, Shhhh!

characters.name: Brother Aimeri
characters.description: Middle-aged male, warm Mediterranean accent, earnest and scholarly tone. A travelling monk from Varlamore who worships Ralos the sun god, intellectually curious and grateful for assistance.

characters.name: Logosia
characters.description: Middle-aged female, refined British accent, prim and dismissive tone. The chief librarian of the Arceuus Library who values silence above all else, speaking with clipped formality and minimal warmth.
